intro: Onoseris lanata, commonly known as the woolly helianthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy yellow to orange flower heads. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower structure. Onoseris lanata typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
